title: Business Responsibility & Sustainability Reporting
description: SEBI’s sustainability reporting framework for listed entities in India. MSMEs supplying to listed buyers often receive BRSR-aligned requests.
eligibility: Applies to listed entities. MSMEs not listed can align voluntarily for supply-chain readiness.
process: Use SEBI BRSR format (Annexure). Compile principle-wise disclosures, ensure board oversight, file with the annual report.
benefits: Regulatory compliance for listed companies; supplier credibility and data readiness for MSMEs.
deadlines: As per SEBI annual report timelines.

title: MSME Sustainable (ZED) Certification
description: Voluntary certification to enhance quality, environmental and energy practices; incentive-linked under MSME.
eligibility: Registered MSMEs; criteria as per scheme guidelines.
process: Apply on ZED portal; undergo assessment/validation; achieve Bronze/Silver/Gold maturity.
deadlines: As notified on the ZED portal.

title: Trade Enablement & Marketing (TEAM) — RAMP
description: Enablement initiative for MSMEs: digital commerce onboarding, branding, cataloging and market linkages (incl. ONDC).
eligibility: MSMEs; see active guidelines and state PIAs.
process: Apply on the RAMP portal; onboarding, cataloging, branding and linkages with support partners.
benefits: Market access, digital presence, sales enablement.

title: EPR — Plastic Packaging
description: Extended Producer Responsibility for plastic packaging; PIBOs and waste processors must register and meet targets.
eligibility: Producers/Importers/Brand Owners of plastic packaging; PWPs.
process: Register on CPCB EPR Plastic portal; meet category-wise targets; periodic reporting.
deadlines: Targets and reporting as per EPR guidelines.

title: E-Waste (Management) Rules, 2022 — EPR
description: EPR obligations for producers of electrical & electronic equipment; registration, targets, and reporting on the CPCB portal.
eligibility: Manufacturers/Producers/Refurbishers/Recyclers under Rules, 2022.
process: Register on e-waste portal; meet recycling targets via registered recyclers; periodic returns.
deadlines: In force since Apr 2023; ongoing annual targets.

title: Battery Waste Management Rules, 2022 — EPR
description: EPR for all battery types; producers must register and meet collection/recycling targets.
eligibility: All battery producers and relevant handlers as per Rules, 2022.
process: Register on CPCB Battery EPR portal; comply with targets; reporting.

title: BIS Compulsory Registration Scheme (CRS) — Electronics & IT Goods
description: Mandatory BIS registration for notified electronics/IT products as per MeitY CRO orders.
eligibility: Manufacturers/importers of notified products.
process: Product testing at BIS-recognized labs; register under Scheme-II; labeling and surveillance.
benefits: Legal market access; product safety conformity.

title: EU Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism
description: Equalizes carbon cost on certain EU imports. Transitional phase (reporting) began 1 Oct 2023; definitive phase starts 1 Jan 2026 with certificates.
eligibility: EU importers of covered goods; exporters must provide embedded-emissions data.
process: Provide product-level emissions; (from 2025/2026) authorised declarant regime; purchase/surrender CBAM certificates in definitive phase.
benefits: EU market access; carbon transparency; decarbonization signal.

title: EU Deforestation Regulation
description: Due diligence on deforestation-free supply chains for listed commodities (e.g., coffee, cocoa, timber, rubber, palm oil, soya, cattle).
eligibility: Operators/traders placing in-scope commodities/products on EU market.
process: Collect geolocation of plots, conduct risk assessment/mitigation, issue due diligence statements.
benefits: EU market access; deforestation risk management.

title: EU REACH — Chemicals
description: Registration, Evaluation, Authorisation & Restriction of Chemicals; burden of proof on companies to manage risks of substances.
eligibility: Manufacturers/importers in EEA; obligations vary by role and tonnage; articles may trigger duties (SVHCs).
process: Determine role; register substances ≥1 t/yr (where applicable); communicate down supply chain; manage restrictions/authorisations.

title: EU RoHS — Hazardous Substances in EEE
description: Restricts certain hazardous substances in electrical/electronic equipment; linked to WEEE circularity goals.
eligibility: EEE placed on the EU market (with exemptions).
process: Assess product categories; ensure restricted substances below thresholds; technical file/DoC; marking.

title: EU WEEE — Waste Electrical & Electronic Equipment
description: Collection, treatment and recycling regime for EEE waste; producer responsibilities.
eligibility: Producers/importers of EEE in EU (country-specific schemes).
process: Register with national schemes; finance collection/treatment; reporting.

title: GRI Standards — Sustainability Reporting (Global)
description: Most widely used standards for impact-focused sustainability reporting; universal + topic standards.
eligibility: Any organization (incl. MSMEs).
process: Determine material topics; apply Universal + Topic Standards; publish GRI Content Index.

title: IFRS S1/S2 — ISSB Sustainability & Climate Disclosure
description: Global baseline for investor-focused disclosure: S1 (general sustainability) and S2 (climate), aligned with TCFD content areas.
eligibility: Depends on jurisdictional adoption; widely referenced by investors/buyers.
process: Apply S1+S2 together: governance, strategy, risk management, metrics/targets; consider jurisdictional overlays.
deadlines: Effective from reporting periods beginning on/after 1 Jan 2024 (where adopted).

title: CDP Disclosure — SME Questionnaire
description: Buyer-requested environmental disclosure with an SME-specific questionnaire (modules tailored to smaller suppliers).
eligibility: SMEs participating via customer request or voluntary disclosure.
process: Use SME modules; align metrics with GHG Protocol/SBTi where applicable; submit in the disclosure window.
benefits: Respond to buyer requests; supply-chain visibility.

title: Science Based Targets initiative — SMEs
description: Simplified route for SMEs to set near-term science-based targets recognized by buyers and CDP.
eligibility: Non-subsidiary companies <500 employees (per SBTi SME rules).
process: Complete SME target-setting letter; choose target option; submit for validation.

references.label: SBTi — SME Target Setting Letter (official PDF)

title: GHG Protocol — Corporate Accounting Standard
description: De facto global method for corporate GHG inventories (Scopes 1/2/3), underpinning SBTi, CDP and many regulations.
eligibility: Any organization.
process: Define boundaries; quantify emissions by scope; report; improve data quality iteratively.
benefits: Accepted by buyers/investors; aligns with SBTi/CDP.

title: ISO 14001 — Environmental Management Systems
description: Framework to establish and continually improve an environmental management system; 2024 amendment adds climate action changes.
eligibility: Any organization.
process: Implement EMS, undergo accredited certification (optional).
benefits: Systematic compliance, risk control, buyer recognition.

title: ISO 50001 — Energy Management Systems
description: Energy management system standard to improve energy performance, efficiency and consumption.
eligibility: Any organization.
process: Implement EnMS, monitor KPIs, optional accredited certification.

title: ISO 45001 — Occupational Health & Safety
description: OH&S management system to manage risks and improve worker safety; helpful for supplier qualification.
eligibility: Any organization.
process: Implement OH&SMS, optional accredited certification.

title: ISO 9001 — Quality Management Systems
description: Global QMS standard used widely in buyer qualification.
eligibility: Any organization.
process: Implement QMS; optional accredited certification.
benefits: Process discipline; product/service quality; buyer trust.
